newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: GCC to discuss Bahrain-Qatar dispute on Jan 6.
newsitem.headline: GCC to discuss Bahrain-Qatar dispute on Jan 6.

text.p: Gulf Arab states will discuss a border dispute between Bahrain and Qatar on January 6 in Saudi Arabia, Bahraini newspapers on Monday quoted Bahrain's Foreign Minister Sheikh Mohammad bin Mubarak al-Khalifa as saying.
"It has been agreed to hold a meeting in Riyadh on January 6 to discuss the issue as proposed by Bahrain," he said.
Sheikh Mohammad was speaking in Cairo where he attended a meeting of the Damascus Declaration which groups Egypt, Syria and the six-nation Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC).
Qatar and Bahrain are locked in a dispute over a number of islands in the Gulf controlled by Bahrain since the 1930s but also claimed by Qatar.

Leaders of the GCC decided to form a four-nation committee to try to resolve the long-standing dispute at a summit which ended in the Qatari capital Doha on December 9. Bahrain had boycotted the gathering.
The GCC political and economic alliance groups Saudi Arabia, Oman, United Arab Emirates, Qatar, Bahrain and Kuwait.
